p: Similarly to lactate, sweat NH 3 is significantly higher during initial stages of exercise than adults, which is thought to prevent further decreases in sweat pH through protonation of NH 3 to NH 4 +. This is also reflected in the lower sweat pH observed in children during the initial stages of moderate exercise in the heat (≤20 min) [ 160]. Further, an inverse correlation has been observed between sweat H + and Na +, thought to relate to acidification of sweat via tubular antiporters reabsorbing HCO − and/or secreting H + in exchange for Na + reabsorption, potentially explaining the greater Na + reabsorption in children [ 160].
